CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 20, reads: "Caught in Act - Radio Patrolman Richard Edmonds, left, and Edward Bailey, right, who is now working in plainclothes, displayed alertness and courage in December, 1954, when they nabbed 20-year-old Augustus Cooper, center, and his 15-year-old wife Joan, as the pair tried to rob the owner of a Hill District grocery. Both young "Heroes in Blue" should be considered for "Upgrading Unlimited." - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of man, Augustus Cooper wearing zippered jacket, standing in jail
